messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Nature supply source?
messages.msgSnippet: Not sure if some one sent this link yet or not, but our fave nature supply source is Acorn Naturalists http://www.acornnaturalists.com/store/ They have a great
messages.messageBody:
Not sure if some one sent this link yet or not, but our fave nature supply source is Acorn Naturalists

http://www.acornnaturalists.com/store/

They have a great catalog, that you can download or get sent to you in the mail.

hth
~Rebecca

--
You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocketship underpants don't help."
-Calvin

In a message dated 5/31/2004 4:10:14 PM US Eastern Standard Time, unschooling1@... writes:



me.  My dd would really like a butterfly net and a cool creature
keeper/something to keep bugs in for a while to watch them

messages.subject: Re: Nature supply source?
messages.msgSnippet: What about trying Wal-Mart or Target Online?  You can shop via email with the major stores like that now.  It may be cheaper than the homeschooling supply
messages.messageBody:
What about trying Wal-Mart or Target Online? You can shop via email
with the major stores like that now. It may be cheaper than the
homeschooling supply stores.

Also, here are a few fun links that may be helpful...

https://www.earthsbirthday.org/secureshop/bugshop.asp

http://www.livemonarch.com/free-milkweed-seeds.htm

http://www.lovetolearn.net/pageIncludes.lasso

http://www.mindfultoys.com/

http://www.uncommongoods.com/

I hope these links help you out...

Tina

messages.subject: Nature supply source?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all.  I am hoping that someone might have a recommendation for me.  My dd would really like a butterfly net and a cool creature keeper/something to keep
messages.messageBody:
Hi all. I am hoping that someone might have a recommendation for
me. My dd would really like a butterfly net and a cool creature
keeper/something to keep bugs in for a while to watch them. You all
might remember that I'm in Turkey, and the store we have here on
base doesn't have much of anything! I did a little searching
online, but I didn't find anything good. There are just too many
homeschool supply sites to wade through, and I thought someone may
have a quick recommendation of a source that they've used before.

Also, we would like to find some kind of yard activities, like those
balls with paddles or little hand net/ball games - something of that
sort. We've been kind of bored lately and need some new
entertainment!

I would totally appreciate any help on this! Thanks!

-Christy
